title: Alien Zoo Adventure #74
goal: Solve the puzzles, achieve the main objective, and escape.

rooms.name: Containment Observation Deck
rooms.description: A sterile observation deck overlooking massive containment cells housing bizarre alien creatures. Holographic displays flicker with data about the specimens. Emergency lights cast an eerie red glow across the metallic walls. Through reinforced glass, you can see creatures from distant worlds pacing in their enclosures. The air smells of ozone and something distinctly alien.

items.name: observation control console
items.description: A complex console with multiple screens displaying specimen data and facility information
items.text: FACILITY STATUS: Galactic Zoo Station Alpha established 2247. Director: Dr. Xara Venn. Chief Xenobiologist: Dr. Kael Roth. Current specimens: 847. Emergency protocols: Evacuation via escape pod bay requires authorization.

items.name: specimen data display
items.description: A holographic display showing information about the contained aliens
items.text: SPECIMEN 847: Crystalline Mantis from Kepler-442b. Status: CONTAINED. Danger Level: EXTREME. Note: Most dangerous specimen in facility. Requires triple containment protocols.

items.name: equipment storage locker
items.description: A metal locker containing observation equipment and supplies

items.name: security access card
items.description: A magnetic card labeled 'RESEARCH LAB ACCESS'

items.name: personnel filing cabinet
items.description: A cabinet with three drawers containing staff records and documents

items.name: facility operations handbook
items.description: A manual detailing zoo operations and procedures
items.text: GALACTIC ZOO OPERATIONS: All specimens numbered sequentially. Highest number indicates most recent acquisition. Research conducted in the central research laboratory. Emergency evacuation procedures require knowledge of facility leadership and specimen data.

items.name: research lab keycard
items.description: A high security keycard with 'DR. ROTH - XENOBIOLOGY' printed on it

items.name: reinforced observation window
items.description: Thick transparent aluminum showing the alien containment cells below
items.text: Through the window you see various alien creatures: a floating gas being, a crystalline mantis with razor sharp limbs, and a bioluminescent blob. The crystalline mantis appears to be the most dangerous.

items.name: reinforced laboratory door
items.description: A heavy security door with a card reader, leading to the research laboratory

rooms.name: Xenobiology Research Laboratory
rooms.description: A high tech laboratory filled with alien specimens in stasis tubes, scientific equipment, and research stations. Holographic displays show DNA sequences and biological data. The walls are lined with specimen samples and research notes. A sealed escape pod access hatch glows on the far wall. The air is cool and sterile.

items.name: main research station
items.description: Dr. Roth's primary workstation covered with datapads and specimen analysis equipment

items.name: xenobiologist research journal
items.description: Dr. Roth's personal research notes
items.text: Day 156: Specimen 847 continues to be our most fascinating and dangerous subject. Director Venn has authorized additional containment measures. The creature originates from Kepler-442b, a planet in the habitable zone. My work here in the research laboratory has been the highlight of my career.

items.name: specimen storage cabinet
items.description: A refrigerated cabinet containing preserved alien tissue samples

items.name: preserved tissue sample
items.description: A sample from specimen 847 in a sealed container

items.name: emergency evacuation protocol
items.description: A document outlining escape procedures
items.text: EMERGENCY EVACUATION: In case of containment breach, proceed immediately to escape pod bay. Security verification required. Questions: 1) What is the most dangerous specimen number? 2) Where does specimen 847 originate? 3) Who directs this facility?

items.name: holographic specimen display
items.description: A 3D display showing rotating models of various alien species
items.text: SPECIMEN DATABASE: Displaying data for specimen 847. Origin: Kepler-442b. Classification: Crystalline Arthropod. Threat Level: MAXIMUM. This specimen represents the pinnacle of our collection and the greatest danger.

items.name: scientific equipment rack
items.description: A rack holding various xenobiology tools and instruments

items.name: high tech binoculars
items.description: Advanced optical equipment for observing specimens from a safe distance

items.name: director's desk
items.description: A desk with administrative documents and facility reports
items.text: DIRECTOR'S LOG: Dr. Xara Venn, Station Director. This facility represents humanity's greatest achievement in xenobiology. Our research laboratory continues to produce groundbreaking discoveries. All personnel must know emergency protocols.

items.name: escape pod access hatch
items.description: A sealed hatch with a security terminal displaying three verification questions. Red warning lights flash around the frame.

password_questions.question: What is the most dangerous specimen number?
password_questions.hint: Check the specimen displays and research journal for information about the most dangerous creature

password_questions.question: Where does specimen 847 originate?
password_questions.hint: The holographic display and research journal mention the home planet

password_questions.question: Who directs this facility?
password_questions.hint: Look at the control console and director's desk for leadership information

rooms.name: Emergency Escape Pod Bay
rooms.description: You've reached the escape pod bay! A sleek emergency pod sits in its launch cradle, systems humming with power. Through the launch tube viewport, you can see the stars and the curve of the planet below. The pod's door is open and inviting. Warning lights have turned green, indicating launch readiness. Freedom is just moments away.

items.name: emergency escape pod
items.description: A compact spacecraft designed for emergency evacuation, capable of reaching the nearest space station

items.name: pod launch controls
items.description: The control panel showing all systems green and ready for immediate departure

items.name: launch tube viewport
items.description: A window showing the launch trajectory and the vast expanse of space beyond

rooms.win_message: SUCCESS! You climb into the escape pod and seal the hatch. The launch sequence initiates automatically, and within seconds you're rocketing away from the alien zoo station. Through the viewport, you watch the facility shrink into the distance as you head toward safety. You've escaped the Alien Zoo and survived to tell the tale! You win!
